title: It's time for Love...
content:

Well, i've had a crush on a certain somebody for almost 4 years, but... I haven't really ever talked to her much. [Sighs] Oh well, how's yours? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] -- Censorship is F**ked! --

title: Re: It's time for Love...
content:
Bah... My heart of ice knows nothing of 'love'.

I voted I LOVE NO-ONE!! (with emphasis on the vice versa bit). But maybe I'm more applicable to Other - whatever that might be. I find that I function better if love is not involved.--------------

title: Re: It's time for Love...
content: I'd vote long-term but without marriage, so I'm confused now

title: Re: It's time for Love...
content:
Well, as most of you could've guessed, nothing. As some long-time members perhaps remember I asked that foreign girl out about 1.5 years ago etc.. (And for those who don't know about this: Nothing obviously happened..)

After that I haven't tried anything, I've partly lost my interest in relationships. I don't care anymore, naturally it'd be nice if I had some female friend, but since there is none, well, then it is so and that's it. If some female wants something, they can come on and talk to me, but personally I won't bother doing anything to start anything.

And have I had a new crush or something? I'm sorry to say 'yes' and I'm kinda embarrassed of myself having such feelings because I know they're completely pointless for me. On a way it's kinda sad to think that I'll probably never see (visually) this cute girl again after getting outta high school in few months. But whatever. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img] [url=http://www.keengrid.net/]keengrid.net[/url]

title: Re: It's time for Love...
content:
KeenRush, just ask her phone number or e-mail address or something, and maybe think up an excuse if you want to.
If she at least knows you, thinking up an excuse should be a lot easier, if she knows you better, you could even simply state the truth and say you want to keep in touch, and see where things go from there.
I love how these things are always so easy for outsiders to comment on. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: It's time for Love...
content:
Ok, I'll do that tomor--NO!!
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] Now when you said it that starts to sound almost like a good idea. But well, I'm 99% sure that nothing ever happens between us. And, I'm most probably not going to do anything. As said in the post above, I don't care much anymore since I can see no way of this stuff happening.
Thanks for the ideas anyways. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

To note, I don't know this girl any other way than that she has just been on many same courses than I have. Ok, I know her birthday and that she plays some instrument I can't remember, but aside from that I don't know anything else (like for example if he has male friend or something). And I guess I've talked her only once, about The Social Contract by Jean-Jacques Rousseau (in Finnish class). It's most probably my imagination that is just now making stuff up, I guess the situation was perfectly normal and her tone just normal, I don't think there was any attempt to get to know me better or anything related to that etc.. Or was it? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img] NO. NO. NO. NO. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] [url=http://www.keengrid.net/]keengrid.net[/url]

I LOVE NO-ONE!!!!!! (and vice versa)
I guess that applies best to me, as many of you probably have already guessed, I don't like a lot people and I always have problems keeping any form of relationships amicable in the long run. I'm sure that someday I'll regret this situation and that I will change it, but until then...

nah...-----------------

title: Re: It's time for Love...

title: Huzzah.
content:
A couple of photos from [img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v192/Jimage/people/T.jpg[/img] [img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v192/Jimage/people/JT.jpg[/img].

Officially, we're at five months, but it's more like ten--it's just that she was technically with another guy at the time. By rights, we should really be at about three years, but she'd convinced herself for a long time that it wouldn't last and "it'd ruin our friendship" as the clich goes.

[hr]KeenRush To note, I don't know this girl any other way than that she has just been on many same courses than I have.
[hr]Heh, I was in a similar situation in Year 11-12. We had completely separate circles of friends but crossed paths frequently, and were in almost all the same classes. I barely spoke to her, and haven't seen her since leaving school.

I dunno what advice I could offer, considering I took the same route you're planning, but I'd say it would be worth at least getting to know her a bit better, find a way to communicate with her outside of school. Start small, and see what happens. Then work on turning her into a Keener.

There'll always be doubt--even when I was completely certain about my current (and first, btw) girlfriend, it was still difficult to get past my inhibitions at first.

I love this forum.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

The development of the hardware, and the greater ability to express every idea that flies into a programmers head, mean that game creators have made the new games congested with every technique in their power. The basic games behind all this are so blurred that people cant catch up. We should go back to basics like Pac-Man and play in an easier, more relaxed way. -Toru Iwatani

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: PA:
content:
Yo... um... miss... what's your face; um... may I, um will you... *sweating profusly* um... *mind blanks... and now can only remember hearts desire* Darling... will you mod keen with me?

-Silence-

*SLAP!!!*

KR, and KR-GF walk out of room. KR has very raw cheeks

"But... 16 colors isn't that bad!"

It's not that hard...

*slap*

KR, with raw cheeks, on PCKF:

Well, I guess I'll never have the thrill of putting an Ilsoap over you guys.

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-stunned.gif[/img]

-- NAJAWA --

Sorry, I won't bother doing anything, but let's see if there happens some miracle that does the job.

Well, aren't we an introverted bunch? The thought of romance makes me cringe, although I'd want to be in a relationship, you know, just to see what it's like, but maybe I should trial a real friendship first. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

I have a few female friends, few online, few in real-life, but i'd never want to pursue a relationship with any of them.

As for "her", it's her b'day today... [sighs] I'm too shy to be around her, i've made a fool of myself before her WAY too many times. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] -- Censorship is F**ked! --

title: Re: Relationships:
content:
What Spleen looks like?
Oh, wait, there are 2 pictures!

I agree with LL on KR's situation.
Even if it doesn't work, you may end up with a new, regular friend instead, and having nice girls as friends doesn't hurt either, as long as you manage to get over them.
The worst case scenerio is nothing at all will come out of it, and you'll never see her again.
Even if she is evil and laughs in your face, then you know where you stand, and you'll never see her again anyway.
Nothing to lose, really.
I wouldn't count on broadcasts or anything like that. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Retodon8

title: Re: Of shirts, and... no shirts
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Does nobody take any sort of risk around here?[hr][/quote]The risk that a girl may controll our lives forever and there won't be turning back? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] I thought that all girls are dumb and some of them are evil until I've met my girlfriend. Now she controls my thoughts and I've already changed my mind about those things. How awful! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-bloody.gif[/img]

The truth is that there's a little risk, but it's too scary for most of us until the right moment. I advice against acting when you're too scared, as that could mean that you are not ready to give up your independence yet.
Love is not a race [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

*EDIT* just another advice: nobody should act on someone else's advice!

title: Re: SOMEBODY TAKE MY TEETH!!
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]KeenRush: I guess I'm just too scared about getting rejected, although that's just silly. I'm crazy.[hr][/quote]
I overheard someone's conversation once about this sort of thought. The advice given was a simple question to ask yourself: "What's worse - Rejection from a person, or the regret of not knowning?"

I think I might be paraphrasing that a bit, so it doesn't have quite the effect as it did when I heard it.

I think the exact same thought as you, KR. Just wait a while, then you'll get too lazy to even bother caring about anyone. Then you won't have to worry about any relationship problems.

Simple as that. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] --------------

title: Re: SOMEBODY TAKE MY TEETH!!
content:
Just don't make too much out of it, don't expect too much.
Set becoming friends or getting a bit closer than absolute strangers as a goal, and if that doesn't work out, it's not rejection.
I don't like every single person on the planet, and the same is true the other way around, but I won't lose a night's sleep over that.
Maybe you'll find out she's really not all that great... it happens.Retodon8

The development of the hardware, and the greater ability to express every idea that flies into a programmers head, mean that game creators have made the new games congested with every technique in their power. The basic games behind all this are so blurred that people cant catch up. We should go back to basics like Pac-Man and play in an easier, more relaxed way. -Toru Iwatani

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: LL is possibly mentally handicaped
content:
LL, you are officially either the dumbest person I've ever met, or you have the truly oddest sense of humour. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-moon.gif[/img]

You make me so confused.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-furious.gif[/img] ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

title: Re: LL is possibly mentally handicaped
content: Wow. Retodon looks so... different than I expected. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] -- Censorship is F**ked! --

title: Re: LL is possibly mentally handicaped
content:
Wow, I look both exactly as expected as well as completely different than that at the same time. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
By popular (?) theory I only started to look like that for the respective observer after said observer did the actual observing, which means... uhm, something I'm sure!
Also I think LL just said she might date me if I was the last man on the planet after all, but you can never be sure with her.

About that picture; it must be... at least 5 years old I think, but I'd have to let loose some deductive skill on my memories to get a halfway decent guess.
By now I am much more mature... or at least old.
Hmmm, I think I still look similar though; no beards, tattoos, or sex changes since that was taken.Retodon8

title: Um...

title: Re: Um...
content:
So far I've been able to hoof any flight of stairs; no need for a wheelchair.
I don't think I have ever been desirable though.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Hehehe: you couldn't go out; there would be no men to run bars, or anything; an LL would want to go someplace packed with women; it may distract her partner.[hr][/quote]

Women can run bars too, but the latter part might cause a concern I suppose.
Of course once the entire planet is only populated with women, there's not much you can do really.
Then again once that happens the population is pretty much doomed anyway, unless less (less "less" is more, but I don't feel like rewriting the sentence) traditional ways of reproducing become more popular, which on the other hand I'm sure they will.

Speaking of Gloo, the link in his ezboard profile is broken.
It should link to [url=http://www.geocities.com/globox88/]www.geocities.com/globox88/[/url] , but it is currently linking to [url=http://p072.ezboard.com/www.geocities.com/globox88/index.html]p072.ezboard.com/www.geoc...index.html[/url] for some reason.

title: Re: Hehehe:
content:
You didn't quote the "less" part right before that; I was talking about artificial insemination, fooling around with genetic material, that kind of thing.
The more traditional way of reproducing, popular or not, won't be sufficient anymore.

As much fun as could potentially be had from being the sole man responsible for creating offspring, it would make for a very limited genepool in the new generation.
Of course there would have to be a lot of baby boys which would be able to reproduce with the already existant, non-related females once they're older, and I suppose their boys could in turn reproduce.
With the time they'd need to grow old enough however, eventually you would need to have younger girls for them to have children with, meaning girls of younger generations, therefore related to them through the original, lone man, and I'm not sure the gene diversity would be great enough to produce healthy children by then.
Then again, I'm not sure with humanity gone there is anybody out there who would mind anyway.

Also, I'd rather have other men remain, as I've been alone with multiple females in more everyday situations, and I can't say I can recommend that to anyone.
I'm sure the same goes for the opposite situation as well.

Hmmm, wasn't this topic about love originally?
Maybe I'm old-fashioned, but so far I don't find it particularly romantic. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]
